definition: current favorite/the latest thing/darling (of the market or the media etc)
abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
new/newly/meso- (chemistry)
to love/to pamper/to spoil/to favor

sentences.english: Not to mention the perfect pal for your drinking needs is not far from a pork and kimchi stir-fry.
sentences.chinese: 當然用蛋包配上泡菜炒豬肉絕對是下酒菜的新寵兒。

sentences.english: Foreman is my new love and Foreman I shall love now.
sentences.chinese: 福滿是我的新寵，從今開始我會喜歡福滿。

sentences.english: Reykjavik is trendy with a lot of globetrotters nowadays.
sentences.chinese: 雷克雅未克現在是很多環遊世界者的新寵。

sentences.english: In January you will become the zodiac's most favorite child!
sentences.chinese: 一月，你會成爲黃道十二宮的新寵兒。

sentences.english: Laca elastic woven cloth has become a new favorite in dress trade.
sentences.chinese: 萊卡彈力機織布，已成爲服飾行業中的一個新寵。

sentences.english: The new author has become a celebutante since the beginning of the year.
sentences.chinese: 新年伊始，那名新作家就成了名流新寵。

sentences.english: This pervert's delight has an MSRP of $99.
sentences.chinese: 這個變態的新寵兒的建議零售價是美金99元。

sentences.english: Now, we're the new darlings of the world.
sentences.chinese: 現在，我們成了這個世界的新寵。

sentences.english: In recent years the term virtualization has become the industry’s newest buzzword.
sentences.chinese: 最近幾年，虛擬化漸漸成爲了行業的新寵。

sentences.english: To match with my reds, I'd have gorgeous violet, today's outfit's mustard, new SS lover apple green.
sentences.chinese: 配紅的還有貴氣紫，今天的芥茉黃，春夏新寵蘋果綠。

sentences.english: 'My new pet elephant, ' Bill replies solemly.
sentences.chinese: “我新寵的大象，”比爾鄭重的回答道。

sentences.english: In design post-graduation education the PhD is fast becoming the new Masters.
sentences.chinese: 博士學位在設計領域的研究生教育中很快變爲新寵。

definition: to churn out large quantities without regard for quality (idiom); rough and slipshod work
Tun District – area of Taichung (in Taiwan) between the coastal (western) part of the city and the mountains to the east
just a very few (idiom); tiny number/just a handful/not many at all/You count them on your fingers.
touchdown/try (sports)
war of words
to obscure the facts (idiom); to mislead the public with prevarication and deliberate falsehoods
lit. to draw a gourd from the model (idiom)/fig. to copy sth mechanically without attempt at originality
color TV
limousine/luxury carriage
to be unwilling to pass on one's responsibilities to others
to join an alliance/admission to the United Nations
sale/market/state of the market/sales event
geek (loanword) (computing)
a hit/tremendous popularity
relay station
to give a small demonstration of one's impressive skills (idiom)
